intro: Asperula gracilis, commonly known as slender woodruff, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that typically reaches a height of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, fragrant, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. Asperula gracilis is native to Europe and is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks.
